page.title: 10LOCAL WATER SUPPLIES(cont.)
page.content: {Warbreck Service Reservoir} This was built in 1924 and 1929 for the Fylde Water Board. It is rectangular in plan, divided into two equal parts.The walls , roof and columns are made of concrete. These reservoirs hold treated water which can be supplied from several sources. These include Barnacre Water Treatment works, which treats fell water and Franklin Water Treatment works at Catterall, which treats river and borehole water. When the Tower was built in 1931, an electrically driven centrifugal pump was installed to deliver water to the tank; it is capable of delivering 25000 gallons of water every 24 hours.Two years later, a second pump of the same size was installed.
